intro: Adelia cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, often surrounded by narrow, grass-like leaves. Adelia cuneata typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
